title: Best Tetris clone
comment: No advertisements, no lame music, and loading times are nonexistent. If you don't like EA or its Tetris app, then this is your best bet for Android.

title: Best tetris app for android, with one tiny flaw.
comment: This is one of my all time favourite apps for tetris. It's clean, clutter and ad free, simple and vibrant. The blocks look great and the music is wonderful. The only drawback is that your points for scoring a line flashes right at you on the screen. This can be extremely annoying when you're playing the higher levels like 19+ would be great if the scores didn't flash at me and were so distracting. Would be 5/5 otherwise.

title: Score system is broken
comment: In normal tetris ppl know the the higher level ur at the hogher scores will be for lines to tertis's. But in this game it doesnt matter. So why should advance players start at a higher level when we dont get more points? Tnis app is full of ,alware.apps self install thereselves dont get this!

title: No datamining. Like so many others
Works very well, oldfashioned
comment: The buttons are old fashioned, but the game progresses well. And very important, it asks for no permissions.

title: Not terrible, not good.
comment: This game is a slight cut above the rest of the free Tetris clones, but overall the controls are bad, the music is average and the graphics are poor.

title: The best tetris
comment: This is the best so far. I like the touch control. Reminds me to the old games. Recommended for tetris fans.

title: This is simply THE BEST tetris app out there.
comment: If you like tetris, there is no reason whatsoever why you shouldn't download this.

title: Great reproduction of the classic game
comment: This is simply an excellent reproduction of classic Tetris. The controls are smooth and simple, the settings are very customizable and is just a pleasure to play.  However, I find that the game feels slightly cramped at the top of the screen: the inability to infinitely spin means less time to adjust blocks to fit in right positions at the top of the screen, especially at high levels. Despite this, I find that it adds an extra dimension of challenge to the game.  Well done!
